#Text=CanadaVOTES : NDP candidate Ryan Dolby running in Elgin — Middlesex — London
#Text=Friday , September 26 , 2008
#Text=On October 14 , 2008 , Canadians will be heading to the polls for the federal election .
#Text=New Democratic Party candidate Pastor Ryan Dolby
#Text=is standing for election in the riding of Elgin — Middlesex — London .
#Text=Born in Chatham , he moved to St. Thomas in 1994 , and recently to the Village of Shedden .
#Text=An employee of Lear Corporation , Dolby is a CAW Local 2168 member , who serves as Union Benefits Representative , and Local Trustee and Chair of the Union in Politics Committee .
#Text=A CAW Council Delegate representative , he was appointed to the CAW National Employment Insurance Committee in 2006 .

#Text=He is involved in community organizations ranging from the St. Thomas Action Centre , United Way , the St. Thomas Women ’s Shelter and the St. Thomas Fanshawe College Campus Advisory Committee .
#Text=Having studied at the University of Windsor , he is currently completing the Labour Studies Certificate Program at McMaster University , aiming towards a Bachelor 's Degree in Labour Studies
#Text=Wikinews contacted Ryan , to talk about the issues facing Canadians , and what they and their party would do to address them .
#Text=Wikinews is in the process of contacting every candidate , in every riding across the country , no matter their political stripe .
#Text=All interviews are conducted over e-mail , and interviews are published unedited , allowing candidates to impart their full message to our readers , uninterrupted .
#Text=In 1996 , the riding was created through the amalgamation of the Elgin — Norfolk , Lambton — Middlesex , and London — Middlesex ridings .
#Text=While it was a Liberal riding for many years , through Jean Chretien 's Parliamentary Secretary Gar Knutson , in 2004 , the riding became Conservative , with Joe Preston taking its reigns .
#Text=Besides Dolby and Preston , the riding 's candidates include Liberal Suzanne van Bommel , Green Will Arlow , CAP Noel Burgon , CHP Carl Hiemstra , and independent Michael van Holst .
#Text=For more information , visit the campaign 's official website , listed below .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why are you running for political office , why at the federal level , why this party , and why in this riding ?

#Text=I ’m running because of the thousands of people who have asked me to run because they ca n’t trust Stephen Harper and the Conservatives to protect their jobs , their health care , and the environment .
#Text=This election is not about Jack Layton , Ryan Dolby and the team of New Democrats .
#Text=It is about you and your family .
#Text=We will act on ‘ kitchen table ’ issues , not just boardroom table issues .
#Text=I am hoping to make a difference by putting families first .
#Text=Previous to this campaign , have you been politically involved ?
#Text=How will you apply your previous work/volunteer/life experience to serving your constituents ?
#Text=I have been involved over the years with the local Labour Council and helping to raise money for the United Way and local Women ’s Shelters in St Thomas , London and the surrounding areas .
#Text=As a member of my local Union in Politics Committee , I have helped out on many campaigns including the Manufacturing Matters Campaign .
#Text=I feel that my experience as a CAW Representative will help me while dealing with members of the community , while trying to solve their day to day issues .
#Text=While In Ottawa , my firsthand knowledge of the problems faced by working people will help me to shape policy and legislation .
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
#Text=Definitely the 3 biggest issues are the Economy , Health Care and the Environment
#Text=For the economy , we will deliver on a ' Made in Canada ' Green Manufacturing Policy that will protect jobs and create new jobs .
#Text=The Conservatives and the Liberals have made many promises to improve the economy and they have failed to deliver .
#Text=Hundreds of thousands of family supporting manufacturing jobs have been lost , including thousands in our own community .
#Text=Jobs that make our communities a good place to live .
#Text=Jobs that the Conservatives and the Liberals do n't seem to care about .
#Text=Meanwhile , the gap between the rich and the rest of us continues to grow , while consumers are being gouged by high gas prices , the banks and cell phone companies .
#Text=For health care , the Conservatives and the Liberals promised to reduce your health care wait times , and they did n't do that either .
#Text=On top of that , today 5 million Canadians do n't have a family doctor .
#Text=The New Democrats will shorten wait times , not by making more empty promises , but by training more doctors and nurses .
#Text=For the environment , the Conservatives and the Liberals promised you they would tackle the climate change crisis and protect the environment .
#Text=They failed at that too .
#Text=Today , our polar ice caps are disappearing , our sea levels are rising and over 20,000 Canadians are dying each year from air pollution , while you pay record gas prices .

#Text=The New Democrats Cap and Trade Policy will make sure Canada lives up to the challenge of climate change , not with idle words or by taxing you and your family , but with tough laws that force polluters to clean up their mess and pay their fair share .
#Text=Is there any misconceptions about you , your leader , or your party and platform ?
#Text=I think the public is starting to recognize Jack Layton 's leadership capabilities .
#Text=The latest polls have shown that people feel he has the skills and qualities they want in a leader .
#Text=Also , people are starting to recognize the sense in the NDP policies and that this is the time for a change .
#Text=There 's a more ways than ever to get your message out , from the traditional campaign fliers and lawn signs , to new media like websites , Facebook , and YouTube .
#Text=The tried-and-true routes get the message out to the masses much easier , but digital alternatives are much more measurable in how many are seeing or interacting with your campaign .
#Text=What seems to be the most effective , from your experience ?
#Text=We are getting an excellent response from our Facebook webpage .
#Text=People can sign up for lawn signs or find out how to donate to our campaign .
#Text=It is an exciting new method to get information out to people .
